result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to 15CM86 and any other sentence presently serving. 95 days credit. Costs waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A. Watts

records.addlTxt: of parole consideration
DOC's request for Court's review of sentence credit granted on JOC dated 1/15/2020 (referred to Judge Sharp for review and response)

15CF107, 15CM86, 15CM168, 15CM186, and 15CM225/plea and sentencing. 01:51 PM Defendant Jesse A. Watts in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Yang recites the parties' agreement calling for Def's pleas to count 1/obstructing in 15CM86 and count 1/battery dc in 15CM168. Case 19CF107 to be dismissed out right. Remaining counts to be DRI including DRI in full of 15CM186 and 15CM225. Parties' agreement calls for a disposition of 6 months jail, consecutive to all other sentences, with 5 days credit in 15CM86 and 9 months jail, consecutive to 15CM86 and all other sentences, with 95 days credit, in 15CM168. Def is presently at Dodge Correctional so these sentences will be served in the prison system. Def pleads no contest to the two charges stated. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty. Sentence:

15CM86 - 6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentences presently serving; 5 days credit; costs waived.

15CM168 - 9 months jail, consecutive to all other sentences; 95 days credit; costs waived.

Remaining counts in these cases DRI. 15CF107 dismissed out right. 15CM186 and 15CM225 DRI.
to appear by phone

15CF107, 15CM86, 15CM168, 15CM186, 15CM225/status. 03:24 PM Defendant Jesse A. Watts in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel request reset.  Status conference scheduled for October 2, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Per the Court, Atty Yang was contact by the COC office about JW. Atty Yang said that the public defenders office needed to be contacted and that from there they would decide if he will be appointed by the case. COC contact the RSCD to let JW know he needs to contact the SPD office.
Status conference on July 24, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

01:50 PM Defendant Jesse A. Watts appeared by video means in custody. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. State informs the court of the current status and request $2,500 cash bond. Defendant comments. Defendant informs the court that he previously had Atty Yang as his attorney and will be contacting him. Court will allow Attorney Yang to appear by phone if needed. Court set bond for $2,500 cash. All CM cases (15CM86,15CM168,15CM186, 15CM225) will be tracking with 15CF107.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

Clerk's review of open cases without further dates find that the Court, in early November, authorized a FTA body-only warrant in this case but the DA only produced a warrant in the Def's CF case. Per AF of the DA's office, warrants will be proposed to the Judge in the Def's CM cases as well.
